headline.main: HAVANA.; Arrival of the Daniel Webster.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Daniel Webster, Captain MINER, left New-Orleans the 5th, Key West 7th, Havana the 8th inst., at 3 P. M., and arrived here early yesterday morning, consigned to M. O. ROBERTS. She brings 77 passengers, $102,000 in specie on freight, with merchandise,

docs.snippet: The principal event of yesterday in the Quaran. line excitement was the visit of a Special Committee of the Emigration Commissioners to the scene of the late arson. We give below a full account of this visit, and of its results, which are not...

headline.main: THE QUARANTINE WAR.; Visit of the Emigration Commissioners to the Ruins. THE MILITARY ENCAMPMET. NEW HOSPITALS TO BE BUILT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The principal event of yesterday in the Quaran. line excitement was the visit of a Special Committee of the Emigration Commissioners to the scene of the late arson. We give below a full account of this visit, and of its results, which are not unimportant. The Mayor, who accompanied the Committee, reviewed the troops now encamped on the island, and was highly gratified with their appearance.

docs.snippet: The extended correspondence from the City of Mexico, which we give this morning, represents in a perspicuous light the condition of affairs in the neighboring Republic. VIDAURRI was advancing upon the Capital from San Lais Potosi, while MIRAMON was...
docs.lead_paragraph: The extended correspondence from the City of Mexico, which we give this morning, represents in a perspicuous light the condition of affairs in the neighboring Republic. VIDAURRI was advancing upon the Capital from San Lais Potosi, while MIRAMON was endeavoring to bar his way with the main body of the Conservative Forces.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Judge Howlin's Mission to Paraguay--Character of his Instructions-The Cutter Harriet Lane--Proposals for the Machinery of the new Steam Vessels, &c. Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices--Nos. 43 Wall street and Astor House. INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON.TON.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge BOWLIN has arrived hero. He had a long interview to day with the President, and with Secre. taries Css and TOUCEY. He will return in a few days to St Louis, preparatory to sailing. Mrs. BowLIN will accompany him to Paraguay. He will be instructed to demand-first, an explanation and ample apology for the indignity offered to our flag; second.

docs.snippet: More than one hundred private schools and seminaries are advertised, under the head of "instruction," in the columns of the TIMES, to open during the present week. Among this large number are some of the most fashionable and celebrated schools in the...

headline.main: Opening of Private Schools in New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than one hundred private schools and seminaries are advertised, under the head of "instruction," in the columns of the TIMES, to open during the present week. Among this large number are some of the most fashionable and celebrated schools in the country, where every variety of taste and requirement for the instruction of the young, on the part of parents and guardians, can be secured.

docs.snippet: With the exception of the arrival of the military at Quarantine, we have little news to report from the rebellious district. Four additional cases of yellow fever have occurred at Quarantine since our last report. Two of them are of Lightermen...

headline.main: THE QUARANTINE WAR.; Correspondence Between the Governor and Attorney-General. MORE CASES OF YELLOW-FEVER. Encampment of the Military.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the exception of the arrival of the military at Quarantine, we have little news to report from the rebellious district. Four additional cases of yellow fever have occurred at Quarantine since our last report. Two of them are of Lightermen belonging to a Newark Lighter, called the Wm. H. Newell. The men are very ill, and have been admitted to the hospitals for treatment.

docs.snippet: From the correspondence of the Panama Star, we obtain some particulars of affairs in Nicaragua. About the middle of the month the Costa Rica government sent a force to Greytown to take possession of SCOTT'S property there and to claim the right to...

headline.main: NICARAGUA.; Transit Property--Who Owns Punta Areas --The Coffee Crop--The Saranac at San Juan del Sur-Incideats.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the correspondence of the Panama Star, we obtain some particulars of affairs in Nicaragua. About the middle of the month the Costa Rica government sent a force to Greytown to take possession of SCOTT'S property there and to claim the right to Punta Castilla or Punta Arenas; but the Commander of the British ship of war Leopard refused to allow Col.CAUTY, the Costa Rica representative.

docs.snippet: The United States steam-trigate ?? look her departure yesterday for Charleston, S.C. where she is to receive on board the captured Africans of the slaver Echo, to convey them to the Coast of Africa. She will not, of course, enter the harbor, but will...

headline.main: Salting of the United States Frigate Niagara.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steam-trigate ?? look her departure yesterday for Charleston, S.C. where she is to receive on board the captured Africans of the slaver Echo, to convey them to the Coast of Africa. She will not, of course, enter the harbor, but will lay off and on outside the bar, and the slaves will be conveyed on board in a steam-jug provided for the purpose.

docs.snippet: On Friday afternoon, at about 6 o'clock, an unknown man was discovered on the premises of SILPHEN HARREY, Esq., in a dying condition. he having severed with a razor the blood-vessels of his arm, producing a frightful wound. Dr. SCOTT was promptly...
docs.lead_paragraph: On Friday afternoon, at about 6 o'clock, an unknown man was discovered on the premises of SILPHEN HARREY, Esq., in a dying condition. he having severed with a razor the blood-vessels of his arm, producing a frightful wound. Dr. SCOTT was promptly sent for, and applied one usual remedies, but without success, us life was nearly extinct before the individual was discovered.

docs.snippet: J. P. HARLEY, a favorite English actor, died suddenly at London, on the 27th ult. He was seized with violent illness while performing his character of Launcelot Gobbo, in "The Merchant of Venice, " at the Princess's, on Friday evening, On leaving the...
docs.lead_paragraph: J. P. HARLEY, a favorite English actor, died suddenly at London, on the 27th ult. He was seized with violent illness while performing his character of Launcelot Gobbo, in "The Merchant of Venice, " at the Princess's, on Friday evening, On leaving the stage, at the conclusion of his scene in the second set, he was observed to stagger, and, being about to fall, was supported by Mr. G. ELLIS, the stage-director.
